column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=The importance of electrical vehicles ( EV ) has been hugely increased , year after year .
#Text=Certainly , their role is critical to answering the problem of the greenhouse effect .

#Text=Indeed , in accordance with the International Energy Agency , in 2018 the global stock of electric passenger cars exceeded 5 million , which has increased 63 % , taking into consideration the previous year .
#Text=On the other hand , several governments have passed legislation in order to encourage the transition from fuel fossil vehicles to EVs .
#Text=In this context , the technology solutions and research associated with these vehicles have become increasingly important .
#Text=One of the fundamental areas of the EV is the charging of the EVs batteries .
#Text=There are several aspects that should be considered for EV chargers connected to the grid .
#Text=It should be considered whether they will be used for slow or fast charging , as well as their impact on the grid .
#Text=Regarding this last issue , the charger must be designed in order to minimize the impact on the grid power quality .
#Text=In this way , it should be designed to ensure that the charger is a load with high power factor .
#Text=Many high power factor rectifiers have been proposed and studied .

#Text=Their topologies have been classified as Boost , Buck-Boost , and Buck , in accordance with their capability to generate an output voltage that is higher or lower than the maximum input voltage .
#Text=Usually , EV chargers are classified as off-board or on-board .
#Text=The off-board chargers are normally developed for high power DC fast charging .
#Text=Several rectifier types have been proposed and investigated as surveyed in .
#Text=The on-board chargers are for reduced powers and are integrated into the EVs .
#Text=This solution gives high flexibility to the drivers since it usually allows the EV to charge through an electric power outlet .
#Text=However , the integration of the charger in the EV will increase total weight , volume , and cost .
#Text=Thus , to minimize this drawback , the chargers should be designed , in order to use as much as possible , the same available hardware used for the traction of the EV .
#Text=To implement this type of solution , it must be considered that the charging and propulsion of the EV do not occur simultaneously .
#Text=Indeed , the vehicle has the electric motor stopped when the vehicle is connected to the electric grid for the charging process .
#Text=So , when the EV is in charging mode , the motor(s) windings will be used as filter inductors , storage elements , or isolated transformers .
#Text=Several configurations have been proposed for the integrated battery charger of EVs .
#Text=These proposals have also taken into consideration the motor type .
#Text=For the case of the three-phase motors , solutions using a Boost rectifier were considered , being the motor used as a filter inductor .

#Text=These solutions require having access to the motor , namely to the terminals of the motors windings , or neutral point of the windings or use a contactor to reconfigure the connection of the motor windings .
#Text=An EV isolated charger for a lift truck was also proposed in .
#Text=Another approach was through the use of current rectifiers with Buck-Boost characteristics .
#Text=An integrated charger with this type of converter and three-phase connection is presented in .
#Text=Due to the converter type , in charging mode , the motor is used as a coupled DC inductor .
#Text=Integrated chargers have also been proposed for multiphase motors .
#Text=These chargers have the advantage of avoiding the problem of torque generation in the propulsion motor that exists in systems that use three-phase motors and Boost rectifiers .
#Text=So , solutions for five , six , and nine machine phases have been proposed .
#Text=However , for many EVs , the dominant motor is the three-phase and chargers for multiphase motors cannot be applied .
#Text=A good possibility is the use of multilevel inverters for the drive of the three-phase AC motor .
#Text=Very few works have addressed the multilevel configuration for the EVs .
#Text=A charger was presented for an EV drive with two , two-level voltage source inverters ( dual inverter ) , in .
#Text=However , the proposed charger was developed for connection to DC power outlets only .
